In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
In this code, `replace(string, pattern -> replacement)` function is used to replace every instance of the pattern in string with the replacement. The `lowercase` function is used to convert all characters in a string to lower case, and `strip` is used to remove any leading or trailing whitespaces from the string.

This function will work for names that contain letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens, and are not empty strings (as defined by strip). For an example, calling `clean_column("My Column")` will return `"my_column"`.
